from.description: An array of file names where files need to be copied from.  Flexible glob Patterns is acceptable relative to the current working directory.

output.description: The location where files needs to be copied to.  This is relative to the current working directory.

oneOf.description: No folder structure is preserved.  Files are outputed directly to the output folder.

A shallow folder structure is preserved if multiple files are specified.  E.g. if files to copy from = [a/b/a/indx.js, a/b/b/indx.js] and output folder is "to" files is copied as [to/a/indx.js, to/b/inds.js].  a/b - is common between them and will be removed.

A deep folder structure is preserved if multiple files are specified.  E.g. if files to copy from = [a/b/a/indx.js, a/b/b/indx.js] the full paths are preserved in output folder -> [to/a/b/a/indx.js, to/a/b/b/indx.js]

cwd.description: An optional directory path if the directory is different to the directory where command ran from.

preFix.description: An optional value to add to the start of the file name.

postfix.description: An optional value to add to the end of the file name.

ext.description: A new extension to add to the file name.

extPre.description: A value to prefix the extension name with.

extPost.description: A value to add to the end of the extension.

noOverwright.description: If true the file will not overwrite an existing file when being copied.
